pr_title: Add tracking of memory allocation per operator

timeline.bodyText:
This is simpler to understand  :)
!(trackOverallAllocation && THREAD_MX_BEAN_EX == null)
!(trackOperationAllocation && !trackOverallAllocation)
Move second check up
timeline.author: viczhang861

replies.author: mbasmanova

replies.bodyText: Much better. I restarted a failed test.
replies.author: viczhang861

timeline.bodyText: nit: maybe better allocationTracker? The word timer is used for the CPU because the CPU utilization is measured in "time" units (e.g.: milliseconds)
timeline.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText: Currently Presto does not support any other VM's than Oracle JVM. How about just trying to cast ((com.sun.management.ThreadMXBean) THREAD_MX_BEAN) unconditionally inplace. In will throw a meaningful ClassCastException if for some very weird reson some other then com.sun.management.ThreadMXBean implementation is supplied.
timeline.author: arhimondr
arhimondr

timeline.message: Add config properties to enable tracking memory allocations

timeline.author: aweisberg
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -113,6 +116,8 @@ public static TaskContext createTaskContext(
             MemoryTrackingContext taskMemoryContext,
             boolean perOperatorCpuTimerEnabled,
             boolean cpuTimerEnabled,
+            boolean perOperatorAllocationTimerEnabled,
+            boolean allocationTimerEnabled,

             DataSize maxSpillMemory,
             DataSize sinkMaxBufferSize,
             boolean perOperatorCpuTimerEnabled,
-            boolean cpuTimerEnabled)
+            boolean cpuTimerEnabled,
+            boolean perOperatorAllocationTimerEnabled,
+            boolean allocationTimerEnabled)

timeline.message: Propagate flags to track allocation to OperationTimer
